attributes.action: Increase the interest rate freelancers can claim for late payment.
attributes.background: Under the Late Payment of Commercial Debts Act 1998, Businesses can claim 8% interest plus the current Bank of England base rate. However this is not enough to deter larger companies from taking advantage of freelancers carrying out non-contracted work, i.e a one-off job.
attributes.additional_details: Late payment can severely impact a freelancer especially during a period of no work therefore it is important that they are able to claim fair compensation, not only to deter companies from exploiting them but to live. If a freelancer were to work one day for £100 and were not paid within 30 days of the client receiving the invoice, the freelancer could claim 8.25% interest (Bank of England base rate of 0.25%) meaning the annual interest would be £8.25 (approximately 0.0226 pence per day).

attributes.action: Prevent NHS basing eating disorder treatment on low BMI, by providing more funds
attributes.background:
Currently, when people approach GP's due to eating disorders, many are turned away due to not having a low enough BMI.
With increased NHS funding, people can be given access to the treatment they need before it's too late; radically reducing the number of lives lost due to these deadly illnesses.
attributes.additional_details:
B-eat, the leading eating disorder charity estimated that in 2015, 725,000 people in the UK were affected by eating disorders; with Anorexia nervosa having the highest mortality rate of all mental disorders. 

According to the NHS, 1 day, for 1 patient in hospital costs around £400. Therefore, money would be saved by giving people the access to treatment they need, before they reach the point of needing a hospital admission; which can last months.

attributes.action: Make the swegway/hoverboard no longer governed by the highways act of 1835.
attributes.background: The highways act of 1835 was clearly not written with the swegway in mind. They are smaller than a baby's pram and a disability scooter and people are allowed to use them in public, so it is unjust for the swegway to be singled out and banned in public places.
attributes.additional_details: At the very least they should be legal in public parks as bikes, being much faster than a swegway, are allowed to be in parks but swegways are not.

attributes.action: Remove roadside signs supported on steel girders
attributes.background: As a retained firefighter for Hampshire Fire and Rescue Service I have recently attended  an rtc where a van came into contact with a roadside motorway sign which was mounted on steel girders. This collision left the driver with life changing injuries. There are a number of these signs on the m3.
attributes.additional_details: I feel that the construction of these signs is a danger to life and there appears to be more lightweight options available that are in use in other areas of the motorway system. A vehicle coming into contact with these signs supported on steel girders will quiet simply be cut in half by the force of the collision. I recently attended an incident on the m3 near Basingstoke where a driver lost a leg.

attributes.action: Child Maintenance Services should penalise applicants who misuse the service
attributes.background: At present Child Maintenance Services only panalise the paying parent, There are no penalties for applicants who purposely abuse the service (see additional details below)
attributes.additional_details: Where an applicant has purposely witheld the child(ren) from a loving parent, and the paying parent has asked to have access or shared care and has shown evidence to have tried to arrange a private arrangement to provide for the childs needs but the applicant has deliberately choosen to withold the child in order to profit from child maintenance, then they should be fined £1000 and made to pay the money back where the courts rule in favour of the parent seeking custody

attributes.action: Those with IBD to be allowed parking spaces outside their home
attributes.background: There are an estimated 300,000 people living with IBD in the UK, and not all of these people can register as disabled. This means that those who don't have a driveway or a designated parking space outside their home can struggle to park and get inside quickly when suffering a flare up.
attributes.additional_details:
A painted bay, or a designated parking space outside a sufferer's home would make a great difference.
It's not just IBD, there are thousands of people within the UK that suffer from chronic illness that would benefit from a parking space outside their home.
Local councils will not help as some sufferers cannot register as disabled, and therefore are not legally obliged to help and in may cases won't.
We're not asking to park in disabled bays, just the ability to park outside our own homes.

attributes.action: I want Parliament to fund the RNLI, Coastguard Helicopters and Air Ambulances
attributes.background: The RNLI, Coastguard Helicopters and Air Ambulances are a vital part of our emergency services and should not solely rely on charity funding to operate, they should be funded just as the Police, Fire and ambulance services are funded

attributes.action: Cash for gold to check all items for smart water.
attributes.background:
My mum has been burgled twice in 18 months. After the first time she had purchased smart water to mark her possessions. 
Smart water can be purchased to mark jewellery or any other item which Is high in value. This cannot been seen by the naked eye, but under ultraviolet black light.
attributes.additional_details: Smart water is a non hazardous liquid, which leaves a long lasting and unique identifier on any item.

attributes.action: Abusive pet owners should face harsher punishments.
attributes.background:
There has been a steady rise in animal abuse in the last few years. In 2011 there was a 23.5% rise in convictions and this is rising.
Many people who have committed these are known for committing  other crimes.
attributes.additional_details: Sign our petition if you think abusive pet owners should face harsher punishments.

attributes.action: Make CPD (Continual professional development) mandatory for the beauty industry.
attributes.background: Most professions in the UK (Dentists, Doctors, Solicitors, Journalists etc... require a minimum number of CPD (Continual Professional Development training hours) to be completed each year. This is training to keep updated in your industry.
attributes.additional_details: The beauty industry needs skilled therapists that are dedicated to improving their skills and remained up-to-date in health and safety of the benefit of both themselves, their clients and the image of this massive industry.

attributes.action: Non paying parents living partners income should be taken in to consideration
attributes.background: Child Maintenance should take in to consideration a non paying parents partners income whom they live with. So many parents do not pay for their children and many of these parents are actually working with either being paid cash in hand or their income being paid in to there partners bank account.
attributes.additional_details: The CSA used to take the partners income in to consideration but was later changed. Now it is easier for the non paying parent to not pay for their child which means the child is going without! I believe as many others do that if the non paying parent claims to have no income (nill rate) or little to none income and is living with their partner who is supposedly supporting them then their partners income should be considered to help pay towards the non paying parents child.

attributes.action: Allow all people with terminal conditions access to trial drugs.
attributes.background: Developing drugs is a lengthy process. When drugs first display effectiveness, the path to approval for use is a long one, to ensure the benefits outweigh any potential risks. But nothing is more risky than death and the terminally ill may be denied potentially life saving treatments in this wait.
attributes.additional_details: The current process of drug development for the terminally ill leaves patients with little power or hope. It feels like what the patient wants is being ignored. In some cases drugs are denied from the rest of the patient population for years after being shown to save lives in the condition, allowing avoidable death on a massive scale. There are many terminal conditions that share this frustration affecting adults and children and babies. Everyone should have the right to the best chance to live.

attributes.action: Require candidates to have lived for 5 years in the area they want to be MP in.
attributes.background: Our MPs seem increasingly divorced from the people who elect them. This isn't helped by all parties choosing to parachute non local candidates into constituencies with which they have no links. Making it compulsory to live within the constituency for 5 years before standing would stop this practice
attributes.additional_details: According to Smith Institute Data, MPs have a very different background to the electorate. 33% are privately educated and 23% went to Oxbridge. The number of professional politicians in parliament has risen from 3.7% to 25% since 1979 while the % of manual workers has fallen from 15.8 to 4. Too often the party central offices are choosing candidates from the Westminster village and sending them to stand in seats in the provinces where they are unrepresentative of the people voting for them

attributes.action: Reduce corporation tax to less than 12.5% give companies a reason to stay in UK
attributes.background: Post Brexit vote we need immediate action from the government as many companies will already be planning to leave the UK. Time is of the essence and we need to halt a mass exodus of  businesses and secure jobs for Britain. In-party politics should take second place to measures such as this.

attributes.action: Make GCSE politics and law compulsory.
attributes.background: The EU referendum results showed that people are easily manipulated by media and propaganda and should have a good basis understanding of law and politics before they should be able to decide the future of the country.

attributes.action: Secure permanent right to reside in the UK for any NHS employee on 23/06/16.
attributes.background: We the undersigned wish that answering 'yes' to the question "Were you working in the NHS on 23/06/16?" means auto-qualification for any future British status.
attributes.additional_details: We cannot risk losing the important foreign peoples that we as a nation have been fortunate enough to bring to the UK and in particular the NHS. Our health would be worse without them and it is imperative that the UK should recognise their importance to our nation by offering them unlimited free passage in to, from and between our country and others.

attributes.action: Use government resources to co-ordinate a modern Buy British campaign.
attributes.background: We can make and grow world-class produce and services in the UK.  Buying British is the most effective way to avoid recession now and spur long-term GDP growth regardless of EU membership.

attributes.action: Raise the voting age in the UK to 28
attributes.background: Due to the level of immaturity shown by the majority  of young people today, lack of respect and generation culture, i feel that at 18, youth dont have not enough experience  to make  judgements that could possibly lead to a nations future.
attributes.additional_details: Lack of participation in national referendum, as low as 28%, meaning they either lack the fundamental knowledge or they just cant be bothered.

attributes.action: Make its so cars don't have to have their number plates on the front.
attributes.background: I don't see it fair that motorbikes are aloud to ride around the uk streets with just a back number plate and no front one, so I think that cars should only have to have a back number plate aswell.

attributes.action: now that the British people have voted , we need an updated  magna carta
attributes.background: now that the British people have voted to leave the eu, one of the wrongs needs to be righted, a British bill of rights is needed to include an updated people's magna Carta to include the original laws but updated for the 21st century, also if possible to be signed &  agreed by the head of state
attributes.additional_details: the magna Carta was signed by the then head of state king John, to protect the people's rights for lawful imgresses, parts of the laws were watered down or revoked by various people over the centuries, therefore losing said rights, but some still stand as of today & as this was the peoples choice to leave the eu, those in charge, parliment etc, should now be held accountable by the said people as/if the  need arises

attributes.action: Propose a referendum on whether or not HM Government should trigger Article 50.
attributes.background: Following the EU referendum and the fact UK citizens can now see it's effect more clearly and are better informed of future plans, we the undersigned propose HM Government hold a further referendum on whether or not to trigger Article50. The result of this should then determine a 2nd referendum.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is due to the sheer number of people expressing they voted incorrectly to leave, some as a "dissatisfaction" vote and the fact the vote was too close to be a satisfactory result. Also the backtracking on spending proposals (eg NHS) clearly left many feeling deceived by the out campaign. UK citizens deserve honesty and integrity from their leaders to make truely informed decisions and that did not happen.

attributes.action: Call a legally binding Euro referendum, 16+ voting age, 2-week campaign.
attributes.background: The non-binding referendum on UK membership of the EU resulted in a majority for 'Leave'. The consequences are becoming apparent. Since the UK has not yet triggered Clause 50, we should re-run the referendum with slightly changed rules, so that voters can decide based on the evidence at hand.
attributes.additional_details: Both sides' campaigns were unsatisfactory in providing objective information about the consequences of deciding to stay or leave. While voters accept exaggeration and distortion of facts during election campaigns, the consequences are generally short-term and reversible due to the 5-year terms of governments. For the EU referendum, however, the consequences are permanent and irreversible. A number of key 'pledges' have already been disowned by Leave campaigners, and some real-life consequences of Brexit have already become apparent. UK voters should take this information into account, and decide what they want.

attributes.action: We need a Government of National Unity elected by Proportional Representation.
attributes.background: Solving the EU withdrawal problems will require help from the best of politicians, regardless of their political persuasions. With Proportional Representation every vote will again count and every voter's interest will be protected.

attributes.action: Lower the Voting Age to 15 so 15-17 year olds can vote.
attributes.background: I think that people aged 15 and above should have the right to vote in future Referendums and Prime Minister Elections. Young adults are taught in Schools about Politics and the Government so they will have a clear understanding of why and what they are voting for.

attributes.action: A referendum should not be retaken for the same issue for at least 10years
attributes.background:
Following the recent vote leave result, a law should be passed preventing the Re-Polling of the same subject for a minimum period of time. I suggest this should be 10 years. 
Once the general public have had their democratic say, this should not be undermined by a second referendum.

attributes.action: Implement a 2nd EU Referendum allowing 14-17 year olds to vote
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon the HM Government to debate and implement a second referendum allowing 14-17 year olds to vote as the results effect everyone not only voters aged 18 and over.

attributes.action: Bring the perpetrators of rape in the Democratic Republic of Congo to justice.
attributes.background:
Young girls and I mean young [under 5 in some cases] are being taken from their homes gang rapped and then left. 

I would like the UK to put pressure on the Congo offering police help if needed to stop this wave of rape and oppression of young girls.
attributes.additional_details:
You can see the story here
https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/jun/20/girls-gang-raped-suspects-free-democratic-republic-congo-president-kabila?CMP=share_btn_fb

attributes.action: To make August Bank Holiday Monday reclassified as ‘England Day.’
attributes.background: Given the rich and illustrious history of England, I propose that this day be given a new name and purpose and call it 'England Day?’ By a stroke of good fortune, historical evidence suggests that this time of year coincides with the emergence of England as single sovereign state, 1091 years ago.
attributes.additional_details: Living in England is a great privilege and we should celebrate this. The transition from Bank Holiday Monday to England Day, couldn’t be simpler or more convenient, coming in late summer it would be part of the three-day holiday. This proposal is not competing with St George’s Day. This proposal seeks to promote a public holiday that already exists, by giving it status and relevance. If this idea appeals to you, please add your name to the petition.

attributes.action: Oppose Wigan Council Application No. A/16/82503/CU
attributes.background: Wigan Council is planning on converting Evolution Nightclub / 36-44 King Street Wigan into restaurants, cafes and residential units. This will seriously damage the nightlife in Wigan and cause many job losses. King street is made up of bars and clubs and employs hundreds of people.
attributes.additional_details: If this plan goes ahead, it will mean that the bars and clubs on King street may receive noise complaints and may have to reduce their noise levels and operating hours. Wigan cannot afford any more unemployment in the town and many of the staff are now worried that they could lose their jobs over this. King street is dependant on its nightlife and see's 1000's of customers every week. Having a residential area in the middle of the street is only the start of what negative's it will bring

attributes.action: Public Inquiry and full disclosure of corrupt covert operations
attributes.background:
Request for:
- Public Inquiry
- Full disclosure of official files 
of crimes by State of Human Rights violations against innocent individuals and / or their families subjected to misuse of covert operations and secrets act (including removal of exclusion notices to the innocent person's file).
attributes.additional_details: A person or family to be placed under covert operations must be a threat to national security by government, law enforcement, secret and security organisation, such as espionage, serious crimes and terrorism.  An innocent person exercising their legal rights in any context that is to democratic laws / policy is not a threat to State. Neither should be subjected to misuse of covert operations and their Human Rights violated.  All records collated constitute criminal evidence by such contravention.

attributes.action: Amend the Care Act (s73) 2014 which fails to protect private paying patients
attributes.background: I was booked for elective day surgery in a Private Hospital but unfortunately, the device was placed incorrectly that has resulted in horrendous physical injuries. The Private Hospital is not liable and the Surgeon denied misplacement that was not discovered until years later.
attributes.additional_details: No tests were offered to ascertain if the device was displaced as I had this surgical procedure privately. I had to vigorously research what tests were needed to identify misplacement and I eventually learnt that a volume and gadolinium MRI would be the only source. These tests were eventually done after much persistence that finally illustrated incorrect placement that has caused me physical injuries and lost career. Members of the public are under the assumption that private paying patients will always be protected but the Care Act 2014 has never protected this category of patients; this Act needs amending to ensure  all of the public are protected irrespective of fee source.

attributes.action: Make Universal Credit an optional benefit.
attributes.background: Many people will find they get less under Universal Credit than they would have done under one of the previous benefits that it replaces. While Universal Credit has a transfer top up amount up amount this will not do anything to help new claimants out in the future.
attributes.additional_details: Therefor it would be reasonable to request that the government does NOT make Universal Credit the only option by allowing people to choose either Universal Credit or the benefits that apply to them out of the 6 benefits that Universal Credit replaces.

attributes.action: Reform the law on the defence of Insanity to benefit the mentally ill
attributes.background:
The Law Commission Report in 2013 recommended a new defence with a special verdict of "not criminally responsible by reason of a recognised medical condition".
Unfortunately this slipped through government policy making and has been ignored since.
attributes.additional_details:
The current law on insanity was made in 1848 when psychaitric illness was hardly understood. 
Despite huge developments in understanding, diagnosis  and treating mental illness, the M'Naughten Rules on insanity have remained unchanged. 
Reintroducing the proposed reform by the Law Commission would mean that people with actual medical conditions won't be excluded by the law and will stop the mentally/physically ill from pleading guilty to avoid the stigma of being classed as insane.

attributes.action: Put a max of £3000 per year for undergraduate courses at university
attributes.background: University students are currently paying £9000-£9250 per year to study at university; seeing as there are no more grants, this is EXTREMELY unaffordable. Many graduates still tend to remain unemployed with a £27000 debt on their mind. Therefore, the amount should be altered to £3000 per year.

attributes.action: Make universal credit phone numbers free
attributes.background: Sign this because it is ridiculous to phone up for help with benefits and money and to have a huge phone bill at the end!

attributes.action: Put the £369 million going into Buckingham Palace into the NHS.
attributes.background: I have been sat in the Children's A and E at the UHW for the past two hours. There are not enough seats, children sat on the floors and mother's with babies sat on baby chairs. There are not enough doctors on and it is evident the longer waiting times are distressing the children and young people.
attributes.additional_details:
During my girlfriends pregnancy, she had to wait 3 days to have her waters broken as there was not enough midwives to give the necessary supervision.

There was a mis-communication with medication due to staff being so busy they missed that she had already been administered. This could have led to an overdose. 

I have also just used the toilets at the UHW and attempted to wash my hands in three different cubicles. There is no soap in the dispensers and no running water in the sinks.

attributes.action: NHS - Give more support to Young Adults
attributes.background: It is extremely worrying & stressful for anyone going to hospital, it is even worse for any young adult (aged 16-20) as whenever you go to clinic, operation or getting a referral done it is extremely difficult, as no one knows where to put you as technically you are too old for children's, but...
attributes.additional_details: ... but are also too young to be in the adults. This is worse when you become an inpatient and they don't know which ward to put you on, and neither is ideal. You spend long periods of uncertainty being passed from departments and you are just waiting for someone to give you the help & support you desperately need. This is a petition for the NHS to give more support and structure within the NHS for Young Adults, (one way do to this would be to introduce specific young adult clinics and wards)

attributes.action: Compulsory teaching of media bias in secondary education
attributes.background: Everyday we are fed information from the media, be it TV, newspapers, news sites, billboards, etc. The media needs money, and so they will do what they need to do to be financially viable, going as far as inciting hate. Compulsory teaching of media bias may help people make more informed choices.

attributes.action: Open Centres that provide Class A drugs like Heroin for free to prevent crime.
attributes.background: If there were Centers that provided class A drugs for free and a safe place to take them. Users Registered, agreed to treatment. Then Drug dealers would have no business, muggings, robberies and shoplifting would drop dramatically and few young people would start using.
attributes.additional_details: Open centres across the country. While keeping the sale and use of Heroin illegal elsewhere, in the Centres Heroin and other highly addictive class A drugs would be given to addicts that register and seek treatment. Over night drug dealers would be out of business, muggings, robbery’s, burglary’s and shop lifting would decrease dramatically as addicts no longer need to commit crime. Lastly, drug dealers wouldn’t be pushing drugs onto young naïve people in order to profit from their misery.

attributes.action: Consider a Nationalised, funded Mental Health First Response Service.
attributes.background: UK Police Forces and NHS services now spend around 30% of their time responding to Mental Health sufferers who do not receive the best attention or assistance. A MH Service that are the first responders to Suicide risks and Sectioning requests, who can convey MH Patients to the correct facilities.
attributes.additional_details:
Working in the Police, it is being increasingly more and more difficult to tackle Crime and deal with Community issues, when every 3 or 4 of 10 incidents we are responding to are for Mental Health patients that require specialised help that we cannot provide. 
This is tying up Emergency resourcing that can be better used elsewhere, and would provide MH patients with the best care and help possible.
Sectioning people and attending Suicide Risks would be better dealt by more a appropriate agency

attributes.action: Make tattoo discrimination illegal
attributes.background: Tattoo discrimination, especially in the work place, should be made illegal, judge people by their talent, not by looks

attributes.action: Fly the Union Flag on Government Buildings on Armistice Day
attributes.background:
Current recommendations from the Department for Culture, Media and Sport do not require government buildings to fly the Union Flag on Armistice Day, 11th November.
It is recommended for Remembrance Sunday, but the omission of Armistice Day from the list is an oversight that should be corrected.
attributes.additional_details:
Armistice Day is 11 November. We pause to observe the Two Minute Silence at 11:00 on this day every year because at the 11th hour, on the 11th day of the 11th month in 1918, World War I ended. During this time, we remember those who have made sacrifices for the freedom we enjoy today.

The British Legion recommends flying the flag on Armistice Day.

http://support.britishlegion.org.uk/app/answers/detail/a_id/263/~/remembrance-faqs
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/designated-days-for-union-flag-flying

attributes.action: Set a time limit of 2 weeks on JSA and ESA decisions to reduce claimants' stress
attributes.background: The film "I, Daniel Blake" gave a vivid and true-to-life description of the possible consequences of long delays waiting for official decisions from the Job Centre et al. The system appears designed to grind down claimants, and cause the greatest hardship. The current system is cruel and degrading.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for companies to label their environmental impact on packaging
attributes.background: The same way we have warnings on packs of cigarettes, we need to inform consumers on the negative effects some of their purchase have on the planet. As a start, we request "Palm Oil Kills" warnings (text & picture) covering 13% of front & back of packaging for products using unsustainable palm oil.
attributes.additional_details: A large proportion of palm oil plantations are developed at the expense of biodiversity and ecosystems in the countries it is produced. Currently, a third of all mammal species in Indonesia are considered to be critically endangered as a consequence. Over 90% of orangutan habitat has been destroyed in the last 20 years and is considered “a conservation emergency” by the UN. An estimated 1000-5000 orangutans are killed each year for this development. More information can be found online.

attributes.action: Introduce the drinking age of 21
attributes.background:
Alcohol has many side affects. It's scientifically proved that it can damage the devolving brain cells of the teenagers.
However the majority of 21 year old are fully developed, therefore the effects of alcohol upon the brain is significantly lower.

attributes.action: Make Marcus Jones review his choice to turn down the funding for mk homeless
attributes.background: Over the last year we have had three of our homeless die on the streets.. There are also people living in  Substandard temporary accommodation in and out of the city. Please review your decision to turn down funding that would of helped these people the government have forgotten
attributes.additional_details:
We have over 500 family's that are homeless... This money would of helped the local authority to provide 50 units to help home these people the gvmt have forgotten... 
People are dying on our streets.. 
Marcus Jones please fully review your decision. 
And give us an answer as to why you turned down the application! 

Thank you

attributes.action: Reverse the decision to close St Bart's Hospital, Rochester, Kent.
attributes.background: There is a lack of provisions in the Medway Towns as it is and we need this hospital. It was used as a rehab hospital for stroke patients and anyone else who needed a longer stay in the hospital. Medway Maritime Hospital will only allow people to stay short term as they need the beds.
attributes.additional_details:
Here is a brief history of the hospital; this is one of the oldest hospitals in Britain, having been founded in 1078 by Gundulph, Bishop of Rochester, for the "poor and leprous". The current hospital building in New Road, Rochester was built in 1861.  The hospital relied on charity donations until 1948 when it was funded by the NHS.

We don't want this historic building to end up in the wrong hands because they may demolish this gothic style building and a piece of Medway history will be gone!

attributes.action: Change the way Tax Credits are calculated to stop overpayments
attributes.background:
Tax credits are state benefits that provide extra money to people responsible for children, disabled workers and other workers on lower incomes.
Have you ever had an over payment for Tax Credits even though you advised them straight away of your change of circumstances as they asked? read on..
attributes.additional_details:
Have you ever received an over payment for Tax Credits?
This is because HMRC calculate your entitlement over a 12 month period they predict that your situation will remain the same for these 12 months, so if you then change your circumstances more than likely you will get an over payment usually in the £100's.
I suggest they calculate it weekly or monthly and remain the same each week/month unless we advise them of any changes and hopefully see over payments £10-30 instead of putting us in debt.

attributes.action: Make it Law for drivers involved in a accident to report to police at the scene
attributes.background: Drivers are able to leave the scene of an accident and be within the law to report it within 24 hours, therefore police are unable to take correct alcohol and drug samples, giving a possible lighter sentence.
attributes.additional_details: Ben regan was killed by a driver who failed to stop and drove home and hid the car, and called the police 10 hours after, to plead not guilty to a careless driving charge due to lack of evidence. Family's are being put through hell because of this loophole. It must be stopped.

attributes.action: Make dealing with panic attacks part of standard first aid courses/training
attributes.background: If we are going to treat mental health the same as any other illness or condition, it needs to be normalised and people need to be trained on how to manage a situation if someone has a panic attack. They are becoming increasingly common, particularly in the workplace.
attributes.additional_details:
At least 1 in 10 people suffer from panic attacks (NHS) - meaning on average at least 1 person in every small business may be a sufferer. Many people will be afraid of the symptoms which can be similar to those of a heart attack - so people need to be made aware of the tell-tale signs and how to manage them.
Hours of work are lost from anxiety related issues, so let's make our nation more open to talk and comfortable when dealing with anxiety and panic attacks.
